meanings.sent1: The wrestler had a mascled physique, looking strong and powerful.
meanings.sent2: She admired the mascled arms of the bodybuilder at the gym.

meanings.definition: To mark or decorate with a pattern resembling muscles.
meanings.sent1: He decided to mascled his shield with intricate muscle-like designs.
meanings.sent2: The artist carefully mascled the statue to give it a lifelike appearance.
meanings.sent3: She playfully mascled her notebook cover with doodles of flexing muscles.
meanings.sent4: The chef mascled the cake with frosting in the shape of rippling muscles.
meanings.sent5: The tailor mascled the costume with stitching that mimicked muscular contours.
